description.en: The main goal of the course is to set a framework for understanding and exploring the main arguments in the growing scholarship on biopolitics and biopower, and relate them to the current political developments in Europe, including the immigration debate, the phenomenon of populism, and the corona virus pandemic. The course explains how biopolitical knowledge might be linked to geopolitics, cultural studies, and public administration, and how it can be helpful in tracing the transformations within the liberal international order.
description.et: Ainekursus loom raamistiku areneva poliitoloogia distsipliini arusaamiseks - aine keskel on biopoliitika ja biovõim, selle põhitõed, argumendid ja teoreeline taust. Biopoliitilise lähenemise kaudu püüame mõistma, uurida ja leida seoseid Euroopa praeguse poliitiliste arengute vahel, alustades sisserändest ja populismist kuni koronaviiruse pandeemiani. Kursuse käigus selgitatakse kuidas võiksid biopoliitilised teadmised olla seitud geopoliitika, kultuuriuuringute ja avaliku haldusega ning kuidas sellest võib olla abi muutuste jälgimisel liberaalses maailmakorras.

objectives.et: Aine eesmärk tutvustada biopoliitika mõistet, selle sõnavara ja teoreetilist tausta. Aine raames käsitletakse biopoliitikat kui mitmesuguste kaasaegsete poliitiliste, sotsiaalsete ja kultuuriliste probleemide seletusvahendit ning selgitatakse kuidas biopoliitika kasutatakse võrdlevas poliitikaanalüüsis.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon the completion of the course the students will:
- identify correlations between the core concepts of the biopolitical scholarship (biopower, sovereignty, bare life, regimes of belonging, governmentality);
learning_outcomes.et: - selgitab seoseid biopoliitika põhimõistete vahel (biovõim, suveräänsus, vabadus, lihtne elu, režiim, valitsemine);

learning_outcomes.en: - explain the current political, cultural and social events through the prism of biopolitical approaches;
learning_outcomes.et: - selgitab praeguseid poliitiliseid, sotsiaalseid ja kultuurilisi sündmusi läbi biopoliitika vaatenurga;

learning_outcomes.en: - enhance analytical skills in critical / creative thinking about the society;
learning_outcomes.et: - parandab analüütilisi oskusi mõistmas ühiskonna kriitiliselt ja loovalt;

learning_outcomes.en: - share experiences of team work and group presentations.

notes.et: Communication throughout the course via Moodle and individual or group consultations.

independent_work.et: Independent work includes weekly home reading materials (academic articles and book chapters), team work in small groups, and individual final papers.

description.et:
Assessment is differentiated according to the following criteria:
A - The content of the paper is systematic and coherent; key arguments are cogently summarized and connected to each other, and duly reflected upon;
B - The paper gives a good and complete purview of the subject and explains interconnections between different topics, yet there might be some imperfections in the writing style 
C - The review of the main points discussed during classes and in the home reading literature is acceptable yet incomplete, with some important elements missing or insufficiently articulated
D - The student demonstrated her/ his ability to analyze and summarize the learning materials, and follow the scholarly debate yet the text is fragmented and sporadic, with no due consistency and coherence
E -  The paper formalistically enumerate some of major points of the course and is limited to simple citations
F - The paper is unsystemic and irregular, lacking in clear connections between the discussed points

grade_preconditions.et: In order to be allowed for the final assessment, students required to perform all two assignments

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade is accumulated result of two positively assessed components:
Group work (50% of the final grade)
Individual final paper (50% of the final grade); deadline for submission - January 5, 2023

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Biopolitics and Biopower: AcademicTrajectories of the Concepts
Key point: why do we need biopolitics and how to use its cognitive potential in political science and international relations?

Crucial Points of Biopolitical Scholarship: Biopolitics, Governmentality, Sovereignty
Focal point: how sovereignty and governmentality complement each other as forms of power?

Biopolitics, Liberalism, Illiberalism
Focal point: how differently does biopolitics function in liberal and illiberal regimes of power?

Biopolitical Violence, Gender and Feminism
Focal point: Belarus

Biopolitical Legitimation of Authoritarian Regimes 
Focal point: Russia

Biopolitics, Security, and Exceptions
Focal points: how biopolitical scholarship can be useful for analyzing international crises and conflicts?

Spatial Biopolitics: Borders and Regions
Focal point: biopolitical bordering

Biopolitical Interpretations of Far-Right Ideology
Focal points: Italy and Poland
Guest lecturer: George Spencer Terry

Visual Biopolitics: Georgia and Ukraine in the Limelight
Guest lecturer: Michael Cole

Visual Biopolitics of Feminist Mobilization
Focal points: Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan
Guest lecturer: Natalya Kovyliaeva

Popular Biopolitics of Displacement 
Focal point: Ukraine

Practical Biopolitics
Focal point: the Covid-19 Emergency
